Innovating for a more inclusive 2030

Inclusive Innovation Tour & Factory

An Endeva initiative

Oct 18 - 19, 2017
Berlin, Germany

ii2030

Event Overview

ii2030 will bring together innovators from corporates, startups, the public sector, NGOs, and science to create solutions for a more inclusive society by 2030

Over two exciting days, participants from every sector will connect, collaborate and construct new ideas.

The conference will foster mutual learning, as well as the creation of valuable partnerships to enhance and share knowledge.

ii2030 will be a first step in exploring not only why these challenges to inclusion exist, but also how we can apply cutting-edge technology and solutions to interrupt them and build a more inclusive society by 2030.

Agenda

Inclusive Innovation Tour

Oct 18, 2017 — All around Berlin

Several tour guides will take participants on an exploration of Berlin’s buzzing inclusive innovation scene to provide inspiration and information around the ii2030 challenges.

For more details, select a track.

Inclusive Innovation Factory

Oct 19, 2017 — Neue Mälzerei, Berlin

In design-thinking labs of up to 10 participants, we will work out how technology can drive inclusive innovation, and what is needed to realize solutions. Participants are carefully selected to bring together those actors who can make the change - and only those.

For more details, select a track.

Tracks

The interactive, by-invitation-only event will employ technology as the engine to manufacture solutions for tomorrow’s biggest challenges.

Precision Agriculture

How can we increase smallholder yields through remote sensing?

Artificial Intelligence

How can we source data on low-income markets through artificial intelligence?

Drones

How can we deliver basic goods and services to remote areas using drones?

3D Printing

How can we localize manufacturing in Africa with 3D printing?

- Coming soon -

Image Recognition

How can we improve remote diagnosis through image recognition?

- Coming soon -
